turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Somewhere near the capital?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: No maglev system.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: The mall?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Georgetown.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Look at the kid.  In this one, he's on the left of the man in the suit.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Yeah?  So?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Now look at him...

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Did he close the front door?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Did Marks close the front door?!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You guys are nodding your heads like you actually know what the hell he's talking about.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Come on, Chief, you think about it, the way we work -- changing destiny and all -- we're more like clergy than cops.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Jad?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Go back to work.  All of you.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Jad.  How come you're not out there with Father Witwer?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: We're in motion on something.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Red Ball?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Nope.  Somebody's thinking about this one.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Amazing there's someone within two hundred miles actually dumb enough to still do that.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: The victim's name is Leo Crow.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Start a location run and a contact search for future victim Leo Crow.  And, Jad, I'll need a Last Known Sheet when you get it.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: I've got no address -- last known or otherwise -- no tax returns for the last five years.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Check NCIC, maybe he's got a record.  Then send a protection team as soon as we lock the location.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I show time of occurrence, Friday at fifteen-zero-six hours.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: That was easy.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Confirm with trig and image.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Any ID on the shooter yet?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Still scrubbing... looks like there's a third party, somebody wearing shades just out the window...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Uh, yeah, you mind getting me a piece of that cake they're eating down there?  I'm starving.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Sure, Chief.  I think I'll grab one for myself while I'm at it...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Take your time.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm sorry Danny, but I'll have to give you the full tour later on.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Your secretaries were all kind enough to give me a look around the office...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: As I recall, they outlawed compression firearms in the District ten years ago.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: They did.  Make yourself comfortable.  We'll be back in an hour.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You mind if I tag along?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: But it's not the future if you stop it.  Isn't that a fundamental paradox?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why did you catch that?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Because it was going to fall.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're certain?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: But it didn't fall.  You caught it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The fact that you prevented it from happening doesn't change the fact that it was going to happen.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You ever get any false positives? Someone intends to kill his boss or his wife, but they never go through with it.  How do the precogs tell the difference?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The Precogs don't see what you intend to do, only what you will do.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Then why can't they see rapes, or assaults... or suicides?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: It was Iris Hineman.  She developed the Precogs, designed the system and pioneered the interface.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Speaking of interfacing, I'd love to say hello.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: To Hineman?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: To them.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Cops aren't allowed inside the temple.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Really?  You've never been inside?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: We keep a strict separation so that no one can accuse us of tampering.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: So I'll be the first one to go in then?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Maybe you didn't hear me.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: If it's a question of authority.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: There's no question.  You don't have any.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I have a warrant in my pocket that says different.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I find it interesting that some people have begun to deify the precogs.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The precogs are pattern recognition filters, nothing more.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: But you call this room the "temple".

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Just a nickname.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: The oracle isn't where the power is anyway.  The power's always been with the priests.  Even if they had to invent the oracle.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Sorry.  Old habit.  I spent three years at Fuller Seminary before I became a cop.  My father was a minister.  Lutheran.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What does he think of your chosen line of work?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I don't know.  He was shot and killed when I was fourteen on the steps of his church in Bethesda.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: At least now you -- and I -- have the chance to make sure that kind of thing doesn't happen to anyone ever again.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why don't you cut the cute act, Danny, and tell me exactly what it is you're looking for?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Flaws.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: There hasn't been a murder in six years.  There's nothing wrong with the system.  It's perfect.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I agree.  The system is perfect. If there's a flaw, it's human.  It always is.  Thank you for the tour, Wally.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You set me up...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I'll write the paranoia off to the whiff you been doping on all night.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: It seems I've found a flaw, John  You.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You gonna tell on me?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Possession alone will cost you six months, not to mention your badge.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: I can't touch you!  And John, you can't be in here!  You'll confuse them!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Wally.  This is Danny Witwer.  He's from Justice and we're to give him a full run of the farm.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: They're not in any pain.  We keep their heads pretty well stocked with dopamine and endorphins. Plus, we maintain careful control over their serotonin levels -- don't want 'em to drift off to sleep, but they can't be kept too awake either.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: It helps if you don't think of them as human.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Her pituitary dumped a week's worth into her system... What did you do to her?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Nothing... she grabbed me, and then there was an image on the screen...

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: She grabbed you?  Impossible.  The Precogs aren't even aware of us. In the milk all they see is the future.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She was looking right at me.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: It could have been a nightmare... Sometimes they dream about the old murders.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She spoke to me.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: To you?  I don't think so...  What'd she say?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She said...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Wally, listen to me...

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Do I know you?  Who are you?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I like you, Wally, so I'm not gonna kick you, or hit you with anything, but only if you promise to help me...

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Oh... Hi, John.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Are these all of her previsions?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: There's no way of knowing for sure. She could've forgotten whatever it is you're looking for...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Just go to the beginning!

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Okay.  Fine.  Where the hell is that?

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Detective.  Nice of you to come down here.  Seeing as every cop in the world is looking for you right now.  Jesus, what's up with your eye?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I need your help.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Well, hey, you didn't have to come all the way down here.  For you, Chief, I make housecalls...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I need help with her.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Well, hello there, honey-pie.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: I'm impressed, Anderton.  You're on the lam, but you still got the time and energy to slice off a little jerky for yourself.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Rufus.  She's a precog.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: She's a precog?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Are you reading my mind right now?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Rufus, for Christ's sake, get up.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: I'm sorry for whatever I'm gonna do!  And I swear, I didn't do any of the stuff I did!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She's got information inside of her.  I need you to get it out.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: No.  No way.  I wouldn't even know where to begin!  Those thoughts about my cousin Elena -- they were just thoughts. I would never --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: C'mon, Rufus, you've been busted twice for felony hacking.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: So now I need you to hack into her.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: I tell you what.  I do this, I get to keep whatever images I get from her head.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: They don't belong to anybody.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Then take her to Radio Shack.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Stop --

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Tell me how.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What happened?  Where's the rest?

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: I guess that's all of it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Rufus, play it back...

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Uh, I'll try...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I scored a goal!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: That's great.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I won!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What a big boy.  How old are you?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Four.  Wow.  What a big boy.  I love you, Sean.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I love you, too!  I love you daddy.  Love ya, dad.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Okay... now let me time you.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Are you kidding?  There's absolutely positively no way, on my best day, I could ever beat twelve seconds!

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: All right, I'll try...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Sean -- you're not real.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: You gotta have faith, Dad.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: It's a little late for that.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Wanna hear something funny?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What the hell.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I lived for a year with a man who was pretending to be my father.  He took me all over the world.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're alive?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: No.  He got tired of pretending.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Oh, Sean --

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: The funny thing is, I started to believe he really was my Dad.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Sean --

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I feel bad about that.  I need you to forgive me.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Once I even told him I loved him.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I forgive you...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: The more you want to believe something, the easier it is to be fooled.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I was looking for you...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I know that.  I know you would have done anything to find me.  I know you would have died for me.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I wanted to.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Good-bye, Dad...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I'm your son.  I'm you.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Sean, wait...

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Hold your breath, Dad...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Six years ago.  Baltimore.  You grabbed a kid at Francis public pool in the West End.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Did I?  I don't recall... I got lots of kids from that place --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Do you know who I am?

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Some -- somebody's father?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: His name was Sean.  Six years ago. Francis pool.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: ... and that I needed his help.  It wasn't so bad really.  I sang him a song, made him laugh, bought him a pretzel.  I took care of him.  I made him happy.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: He's alive?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Where've you got him?  Is he all right?  Tell me, you fuck -- WHERE IS HE?!

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: I put him in a barrel and sunk him in the bay.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: It floated back up.  I had to take him out and --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: You're not gonna kill me?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: But you have to.  They said you would.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The precogs were wrong.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: If you don't kill me, my family gets nothing!

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: You're supposed to kill me.  He said you would.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Who said I would?

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Look, I've put my family through enough misery.  You gotta kill me! This way I can leave 'em something.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Crow.  I'm not gonna kill you.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Look, believe me, I know it's hard, but you gotta do it --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm asking you again, who made you do this?

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: I don't know -- I never saw his face.  All I know is, the next day I was out, so the guy must've had juice somewhere.  Look, man, you gotta go through with this.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What the fuck is going on?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What about the picture --

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Fake.  He gave it to me.  Now --  -- shoot me, Goddammit, before I lose my nerve!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Tell me, who was it, set this up?

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: If I tell you, my family gets nothing.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Who made you do this?

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: Kill me!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Tell me!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Let go of the gun.

turns.speaker: CROW
turns.text: You're not gonna kill me...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Good-bye, Crow.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Something wrong?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm a little dizzy...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Yes, I'm afraid that would be from the Doll's Eye.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: The vine -- the Baneberry that scratched you during your illegal climb over my wall...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: You have three minutes to tell me what you're doing here before I feed you to a few of my more predacious plants.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm... not... a... killer.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Just what is it you think I can do for you?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You can tell me how someone... could fake a prevision.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: And how would I know that?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What's so funny?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: If the unintended consequences of a series of genetic mistakes and science gone haywire can be called invention, then yes, I invented precrime.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You don't seem all that proud.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: I'm not.  I was trying to heal them, not turn them into... something else.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Heal who?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: The innocents we now use to stop the guilty.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're talking about the precogs...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: You think the three in the tank come from a test tube?  They're merely the ones who survived.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: It began as play.  A guessing game like you play with any toddler, except these children always guessed right.  And then the nightmares started. They were all different, but all the same.  They were all about murder.  And the murders were all happening.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: And how did Lamar become involved?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Back then, he was still a DA, and quite a few parents of my patients had passed through his courtroom. You have to understand, these people were the dregs of society. But once they saw their children... he decided he would do whatever he could for them.  He's that way, you know, paternal about certain things.  Precrime.  The precogs. You.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You say some of the children died?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: So many of them... despite what we did for them.  Or maybe because of what we did to them.  It doesn't matter.  It's a perfect system now, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm not a murderer.  I've never even met the man I'm supposed to kill.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: And, yet, a chain of events has started.  A chain that will lead inexorably to his death.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Not if I stay away from him.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: How can you avoid a man you've never met?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: So you won't help me?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: I can't help you.  No one can.  The Precogs are never wrong.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Most of the time, all three Precognitives will see an event in the same way.  But once in a while, one of them will see things differently than the other two.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Jesus Christ -- why didn't I know about this?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Because these Minority Reports are destroyed the instant they occur.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Obviously, for Precrime to function, there can't be any suggestion of fallibility.  After all, what good is a Justice system that instills doubt?  It may be reasonable, but it's still doubt.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're saying that I've halo'd innocent people?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: I'm saying that every so often those accused of a precrime might, just might, have an alternate future.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Does Burgess know about this? About the Minority Report?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: I used to joke with Lamar that we were the mother and father of Precrime.  Well, in my experience, parents often see their children as they want them to be, not as they are.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Answer my question.  Did Lamar Burgess know about the Minority Report?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Yes, of course, he knew, but at the time, he felt -- we both felt their existence was... an insignificant variable.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Insignificant to you maybe, but what about those people I put away with alternate futures?  My God, if the country knew there was a chance they might not --

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: The system would collapse.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I believe in that system...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Do you?  Really?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You want to bring it down.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: But you will bring it down if you kill Leo Crow.  Why, that will be the most spectacular public display of how Precrime... didn't work.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm not gonna kill anybody.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Hold that thought.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why should I trust you?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: You shouldn't.  You shouldn't trust anyone... certainly not the Attorney General who wants it all for himself.  Not the young federal agent who wants your job.  Not even the old man who just wants to hang onto what he's created.  Don't trust anyone.  Just find the Minority Report.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You said they're destroyed.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: I said the record is destroyed. The original report exists for all time.  I designed the system so that whenever a report occurred, it would be stored in a safe place -- but not declared.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What safe place is that?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: The safest place of all.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Inside the Precog who predicted it.  All you have to do is download it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: That's all, huh?  Just walk right into Precrime, go into the Temple, somehow tap into the Precogs, and then download this Minority Report...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: If... you have one.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: -- and then walk out.

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Actually, I think you'll have to run out, but yes, that's what you have to do.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're insane or you think I am.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'll get EYEscanned a dozen times before I get within ten miles of Precrime.  They'll pick me up...

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: Sometimes in order to see the light, you have to risk the dark.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: How do I even know which one has it?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: It's always in the more gifted of the three.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Which one is that?

turns.speaker: IRIS
turns.text: The female.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: John?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON'S VOICE
turns.text: He's dead, Lara.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Oh, God, what did you do?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON'S VOICE
turns.text: Nothing.  I didn't kill him.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Then how did he --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON'S VOICE
turns.text: Lara, I don't know why this is happening.  I just know they're setting me up.  I can't trust anybody.  I don't know who to talk to or where to go...  Lara?  Are you there?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: This is all my fault.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: No, it isn't, Lamar.  There was nothing anyone could do.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I haven't worn this damn thing in years.  I just wanted to make sure it fits before tonight.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: You look great.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: It's insanity around here.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I thought you were retiring?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I was, but this whole incident with John made me realize the fragility of what we've built here.  This is John's legacy as much as mine and I want to protect that.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Anne Lively.  John was talking about her right before they took him.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I don't know who that is.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: John said something about him being set up because he "found out about her."

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: We know why John was tagged.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: He also said Crow was a fake.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Lamar, do you know the reason why John came here to work with you?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Sean --

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: No.  That's what everyone thinks.  John shot a man dead in Baltimore six months before.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: No.  I don't think you do.  The other day, when he came to the cottage, he talked about a lot of things, but Danny Witwer, the man he was supposed to have just killed?  He didn't mention him.  He didn't say his name even once.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: But I also know why he married you: you're as stubborn as he is.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Lamar --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: All right.  Tell you what I'll do. First thing Monday, I'll look over the Witwer evidence and I'll have Gideon run the Containment files, see if anyone drowned a woman named -- what did you say her name was?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Anne Lively... But I never said she drowned.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: The guy from USA Today is here.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Tell him not now.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He just wanted a few minutes before --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Not.  Now.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Sir, the press conference is starting.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Congratulations, sir.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: My God...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: How did you get this?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: I padded your expense account for the last six months.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: You have an emergency call on your private line.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Thank you.  This is Burgess.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: He came to see you yesterday. Right before he got tagged.  What did you talk about?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: The Mets.  John doesn't think they've got a deep enough pitching roster this year, and I'm inclined to agree.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Why are you protecting him?  You knew he was doping, yet you did nothing about it.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: The man lost a child, for Christ's sake...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Six years ago.  What did you two talk about yesterday afternoon?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: None of your damn business.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Oh, it's all my damn business now, Lamar.  Investigation of a supervising office for a capital crime falls under federal jurisdiction... so as to rule out any possibility of conspiracy.  He's my suspect.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: He's my subordinate!

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Shall we call the Attorney General? I'm sure he'd be happy to clarify the issue for you.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I don't want John Anderton hurt.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Lamar, I found something.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I don't wanna say over the phone, but I think we may be chasing the wrong man.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Good God.  What was that?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Wait, just a second...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: He told me about this.  You got this from Containment?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Yes.  This is from the twins, Arthur and Dashiel.  Agatha's stream was missing.  Now this one is from the cyberparlor.  Anderton downloaded it directly from Agatha. Watch...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: It's the same prevision.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Not quite.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Now the second image.  Watch the water.  The wind's changed.  The ripples are going the other way.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I don't understand --

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: This murder is happening at two different times.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: According to the Sentry, Anderton was watching this at Containment right before he was tagged.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I know.  He came to me, told me about the missing data stream.  He was concerned that you might find it.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I did find it.  It was inside of Agatha all this time.  So the question is, why would someone want this erased from the data file?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Danny, tell me what you're thinking.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I'm thinking someone got away with murder.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: By fooling the system.  All someone would have to do is wait for Precrime to stop the murder from taking place, then, a few minutes later, commit the crime in exactly the same way.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Yes... It's called an echo.  The act of murder is such a violent disturbance in the future continuum that it sometimes repeats to the Precogs.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Precog Deja Vu...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: We teach the tech's to identify them and disregard...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: So there is a way to fool the system?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Of course, it would have to be someone with access to the Prevision in the first place, someone fairly high up --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Shhh.  You know what I hear?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Nothing.  No footsteps coming up the stairs.  No hovercraft out the window.  No clickity click of little spyders.  No one crashing through that door.  And do you know why I don't hear any of those things, Danny?  Because right now, the Precogs can't see.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Near Death's real popular right now, which includes everything from getting hit by a car, to falling off a high building to plane crashes.  It's a big rush, you come out the other side without a heart attack.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I wanna kill my boss.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Okay.  You got some images I can work with?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Good.  What I can do is set you up down in the --

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Uh, yeah, being concert master of the Philadelphia Symphony Orchestra is one of our most popular choices...

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: No, I wanna kill my boss!

turns.speaker: RUFUS
turns.text: Get the hell outta here.  You sick bastard.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: This is Evanna, the team pilot.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Nice to meet you.  Gum?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: So if you wanna kill someone, you take him to Miami.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Not after the vote next week.  Once the Amendment passes, we go national, there's gonna be nowhere to run.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Can't they shut that off?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: That's the Red Ball Alarm.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Crime of passion.  No premeditation.  They show up late. Most of our scrambles are flash events like this one.  We rarely see anything with premeditation anymore.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: People have gotten the message.  Gum?
